intro: Witheringia morii, commonly known as the Japanese willow herb, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Witheringia morii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
